verses.roman:
kaṇḍūtyā nibhṛtair dorbhir
yuyutsur dig-gajān aham
ādyāyāṁ cūrṇayann adrīn
bhītās te 'pi pradudruvuḥ

synonyms: kaṇḍūtyā—with itching; nibhṛtaiḥ—filled; dorbhiḥ—with my arms; yuyutsuḥ—eager to fight; dik—of the directions; gajān—the elephants; aham—I; ādya—O primeval one; ayam—went; cūrṇayan—crushing to powder; adrīn—mountains; bhītāḥ—frightened; te—they; api—even; pradudruvuḥ—ran away.
translation: Eager to fight with the elephants who rule the directions, O primeval lord, I went forth, pulverizing mountains with my arms, which were itching for battle. But even those great elephants fled in fear.
